newsitem.title: USA: Masco sees Q2 EPS at or over expectations.
newsitem.headline: Masco sees Q2 EPS at or over expectations.

text.p: Masco Corp said Tuesday it expects second quarter earnings to meet or exceed analysts' consensus estimate of $0.54 per share. It said it expects double-digit sales growth to continue.
Masco earned $0.39 a share in the second quarter of 1996.

"The company anticipates that second quarter sales growth will exceed the 12 percent growth rate achieved in the first quarter, and that second quarter earnings will equal or modestly exceed the current investment analysts' consensus forecast of approximately $0.54 per share," Chairman Richard Manoogian said at an investor conference.

"Based on present economic trends and assuming that the economy maintains its present rate of moderate growth, the company believes that it will achieve record sales and earnings in its home improvement and building products businesses for all of 1997," he said.

Masco Corp manufactures home improvement and building products under brands including Delta and Peerless faucets, Merillat, KraftMaid and StarMark cabinetry, Brass Craft and Plumb Shop plumbing specialties, Baldwin hardware, Weiser locks, Thermador appliances, Aqua Glass bath and shower units, Watkins Hot Spring spas and Gale insulation installation.
